page.title: 06Wild Flowers
page.content: In and around Hazelton there are little country lanes where lots of wild flowers grow. The commonest one we saw was Cow Parsley. The least common was Red Campion. The rudest flower was called Bloody Cranesbill. A dandelion has a nice yellow flower with nice green leaves. When it dies it turns into a dandelion clock you can blow. The seeds float down and grow into dandelions again. The smallest flower was the speedwell. In amongst the long grass we found some vetch plants climbing up to the sunlight. We think wild flowers are very pretty and should not be covered by chemicals. The farmers should not spray the fields by helicopter because the wind can blow the chemical droplets onto our wild flowers.
